messages.message:
Hi Team
Here is the documentation on how to do this:
https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TI/pages/3018981484/How+to+migrate+a+public+app+to+new+env

The scripts are at
https://github.com/instabase/instabase/tree/master/tools/deploytools/aihub

I recorded a short video showing how to migrate one env to another
https://drive.google.com/file/d/103PIJYWCy3a-HWKvPa6CgwUuRQ09HGEd/view?usp=sharing
Also have a short video showing how to make an app a public app. This is likely already done for you if you are copying an existing public app. (https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ZTklklKsMVWBE2EBdTRhDDhpsL2RjljX/view?usp=sharing)
@Anshu I hope you can take it from here. Let me know if you encounter any issues.

Thanks @Anil
@Anshu @Kim Acevedo i would like someone to try this on a sandbox and if it works xsseamlessly we need to deploy to every ST customer we have

@Anil Is there any reason we can't have this as part of the platform? Deploying every Marketplace app individually to every ST env is not a scalable solution. Ideally when we spin a new ST env, we should add one more step to publish all the Marketplace apps there as well.

Yup that would be good to have. We don’t have that yet.
Most envs are single tenant - so it should be quite simple with the script now.

@Anshu yes, we have https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-3674 for tracking this effort

@jack.robbins should we add this to the Q3 wishlist?
Yeah, it’s on my list for sure, we’ll know more if it could feasibly fit in Q3 once we get to detailed planning & trade offs.
